original: My mother recently died from Bowel Ischemia and Septic Shock.  My question is this, she was in the ER for 12 hours before she was even seen by the general surgeon and then he wasn't convinced that it was this condition yet.  He said that he'd check on her in the morning once she was finally put into an ICU room (this was at 11 p.m.).  I last spoke to her at midnight that evening and that was the last time that she was conscious.  By the time she got to the ICU just 2-3 hours later, she was unresponsive and put on life support.  Surgery was eventually performed later that afternoon and 90% of her small intestine had to be removed.  She died early the next evening.
